ai-patthana18.14:0.2_0: Having given the immaculateness of the Dhamma, third in the place he had allowed to,
ai-patthana18.14:2.1_0: or cause or reason it doesn’t give rise to cause or reason.
ai-patthana18.14:2.1_3: the snake having given up horns,
ai-patthana18.14:3.1_0: for the sake of this teaching, not for the sake of another, or for the sake of a cause or condition.
ai-patthana18.14:3.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana18.14:4.1_0: You don’t give rise to causes and conditions for the sake of this.
ai-patthana18.14:5.1_0: for the sake of not insisting on repulsion there is no cause or condition.
ai-patthana18.14:5.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana18.14:6.1_0: Without repulsion, not unresultaneousness gives rise to causes.
ai-patthana18.14:7.1_0: for the sake of another, or for the sake of the teaching, there is no cause or condition for the sake of countering.
ai-patthana18.14:7.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana18.14:8.1_0: for form, or for the sake of the teaching, not for the sake of form,
ai-patthana18.14:9.1_0: I don’t give rise to the cause or condition for the sake of form, or for the sake of a without cause.
ai-patthana18.14:9.1_1: And it is the reason why these three objects have passed away ...
ai-patthana18.14:9.1_3: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana18.14:10.1_0: For in this world it doesn’t give rise to the best cause or reason.
ai-patthana18.14:11.1_2: What four trivial trees have been uneven.
ai-patthana18.14:13.1_0: or cause a reason for the sake of looking at the world.
ai-patthana18.14:13.1_2: What is not the reason for two reasons.
ai-patthana18.14:14.1_0: Or if someone were to ask a teaching with no cause or reason for someone else, they don’t give rise to these three conditions. ...
ai-patthana18.14:15.1_0: or only one who understands the Dhamma for a long time.
ai-patthana18.14:16.1_0: or known by the sake of which I might haven’t known or seen or realized the sake of having known, may I not give up the reason for these three conditions.
ai-patthana18.14:17.1_0: Avoiding some things, they don’t give rise to a cause or reason for sake of something connected with reason.
